Name: Requiring luxury limousine services to provide proof of vehicle safety inspections at the time of contract.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring luxury limousine services to provide proof of vehicle safety inspections at the time of contract

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Summary: This bill would require for-hire luxury limousine companies to provide proof of safety inspections for its licensed vehicles at the time a person contracts with the company for the transportation of passengers.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 5 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-553 to read as follows:
      � 19-553 Proof of safety inspection for luxury limousines. a. A luxury limousine base shall maintain proof of a valid and current certificate of inspection received pursuant to subdivision f of section 19-504 of this chapter for each luxury limousine licensed by the commission. Such proof of a certificate of inspection shall be provided to a person contracting with such luxury limousine base at the time a contract is entered into for transportation of a passenger by such luxury limousine.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law, except that the taxi and limousine commission may take such actions as are necessary to implement this local law, including the promulgation of rules, before such date.
